Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. The front desk staff was nice enough and the bar was rockin' when we arrived. Restaurant/bar area seems to be quite the place to party for the 20 somethings. Rooms are very clean and the Tempur-pedic beds are perfect! Our balcony opened up to the water and overlooked the tower deck. A delightful place. We'll recommend it and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: AustinMercy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I who Iive in Austin, TX went to San Diego for our son's lacrosse tournament and decided to stay on our own away from the team. Tower 23 is a "groovy" hotel RIGHT on the beach! Being an Interior Designer, I'm very particular about my accomodations and I have to say, I was not disappointed. The decor is just what I expect from a "boutique hotel". Our room was decorated modernly with a bank of sliding glass doors which offered up a full ocean view. The service was outstanding from the moment we checked in to the final check out, four days later. The second story deck is where we ended every day lounging in a chaise, drinking a glass of wine and eating the steamed mussels with chorizo, capped by breathtaking sunsets. Drew, our waiter those evenings, gave us impecable service along with a nice array of menu selections , which is probably why we didn't venture elswhere. We were there mid January, and the boardwalk between the beach and the hotel was not too busy until Sunday when the locals turned out for "Sunday-Funday". The only drawback with being beachside, was late around 2am when the "last call" revelers would walk down the sidewalk and wake us up. I'm sure that could have been allieviated if I hadn't instisted on keeping the sliding door wide open every night, but listening to the ocean was a must..... There's a lot of hustle a bustle going on in and around the hotel so keep that in mind if you're looking for a really quiet atmosphere. We'll be returning for my husbands 50th birthday in April!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible place to stay while on business in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: countindayz
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Pacific Beach just one other time and vowed to never stay again. I love San Diego and just seemed to enjoy staying in the city in several fantastic big hotels and smaller boutique hotels. But this time my meeting was on Mission Bay and I wanted to be closer. I kept seeing Tower 23 reviews and thought I'd give it a try. Gosh am I ever glad I did! The staff was great....from the first phone call to make the reservations to check out. They gave me an incredible room that was isolated, quiet and had a view that was just incredible. I was on business, leaving me not enough time to enjoy the hotel more. But just having a beautiful, clean and very quiet room to come back to....with a bed to DIE for each night was great. Perks: - Great valet parking. First time that I've never had to wait one minute for my car. It was there as soon as I got off the elevator EACH time - Safe. Important to me as a single woman to feel safe, and this well staffed and well secured hotel made me feel very safe. You can't just pop in from the beach, its very secured. - View. The very best oceanview in San Diego....just couldn't get any better. - Room service. Unsurpased for both time and quality - Bed. Best of the best....great mattress, linens and best pillows ever. Lots of pillows! - Bath. Great soaking tub and rain shower. - Location. Great! - Staff. Very attentive Bottom line, they keep it clean and simple. Very zen. Loved the deck and "bonfire" each night. Thanks so much, Tower 23 for being so nice and accomodating to a real non-jett setter and for the great room. I can't wait to go back, next time I hope its for vacation! But the next time I come to San Diego on business travel, I plan on calling you first for availability.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly1639
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with young children, be sure to ask for a room away from the bar....the room service is awesome!! Our room opened up onto the deck which was nice when the baby was napping. Be sure to go to Kono's beachfront restaurant just down from the hotel for wonderful breakfast and the best coffee ever! The beds were very comfortable. The location was perfect for attending a baseball game and going to Sea World. Not really designed for families, lots of younger partying people, but we still enjoyed our stay and would love to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than most in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: SWTTRAVELS
Reviews.Content: This is kind of a boutique hotel right on the beach in the Pacific Beach area of San Diego. The hotel is clean and chic without being snobby - retains laid back beachy vibe. The rooms are nice and the courtyard in the middle of the hotel has a fantastic view. The beach bar is fun and the service was really good. We stayed with our dog which was great as few hotels in the area allow dogs - the price for the dog was steep though - we stayed one night and it was $75 non-refundable. I would say that the price of the hotel is a little high but the only other alternatives in the area are pretty run down hotels. We will definitely stay here again when we come down to San Diego for the night.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: javacode
Reviews.Content: Tower 23 was a good find in San Diego. The hotel is right in front of the beach. Some things to consider: 1) It does no offer breakfast service in the restaurant. Only in your room or in the patio. The patio area is nice because it has a direct view of the sea shore. 2) The garage door closes at night, so if you are having to park late at night, you might have to find parking in the street. Check with the concierge to see if they open the garage door if this happens. the hotel has a modern design to it. Lots of use of concrete and glass. Had lunch at the restaurant and it was very good. in general, I would recommend this place to anyone visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “HAPPY RETURNERS”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd summer my partner and I come in SD for a few days, to end a road trip. We loved Tower23 the first time. We loved it even better the second time. And this has even improed with our third stay. So far we only stayed in the Surf Pads, right at the front of the hotel. We had different rooms each time, on the part away from the bar which I would recommend. They are all basically the same, only one got a separate shower stall, but we could noy get it this year. Same with this price tag. What do we like ? The STAFF is young and smiling and willing to help. But this is no Four Seasons by any mean ! SITUATION-situation-situation !!! It is all about it : right on the beach. Could not get any closer, except perhaps one of the privat beach house at Malibu. Anyone, if you think of a hotel of this standard on the West Coast closer to the ocean than Tower23, please share it with me. The STYLE is great. We are a very traditional same sex couple in our 40s, and we love luxury. We travel a lot. This is a special place : not the most luxurious. There is a nice vibe to it. Plenty of different people mingle, but you can have total privacy and tranquillity(that you would not have in a room right on the deck). The DECK is a highlight, at any given time. For sunbathing, for having a drink, for smoking by the fire pit. Would it be better with a pool ? My partner tends to think so, I personnally prefer the space. The UPKEEP is amazing. Despite an oceanfront situation, the whole place is immaculate. Not a glitch or a hint of ageing. They do a great job at that. HOUSEKEEPING is fantastic. I do not generally rave on housekeeping and how fantastic a clean room is; it should be standard in any accomodation, let alone a premium accomodation. But everyday, these guys clean thewindows and the glass balcony, so that he view is not spoilt. Worth mentionning, especially in the perspective of the poor job most urban luxury hotels do. The RATES; not cheap of course, but they come down year after year. Business must be slow. Breakfast food is good. Not terrific.But good. Although we got tired of the limited choice after a couple of days. And having breaksfast on the balcony is great. DIRECT ACCESS to the beach is extremely convenient. What do we dislike ? VALET PARKING is a rip-off. Given that free parking is very limited, and this is no San Francisco, they hot hard on that. Mind them, business was so slow that we managed to park free on the roads every time. CLOSED RESTAURANT until 11.00 am. So we had breakfast on the balcony. Which was great. Holding our plates on our knees was a disgrace. It as last year, and still is this year. So please guys, open up earlier for breakfast, or bring in a table ! DIRECT ACCESS from the beach is no more possible. They removed the opening device. Most unconvenient when you want to walk to the deck with a cigar. NO ACKNOWLEDGEMENT of returning customers : a bottle of something would not really hurt. They do that in other hotels where we go (Hotel Bel-Air, ...). Would we return ? Looking forward to !

Reviews.Title: “decided not to stay”
Reviews.Author: kka57
Reviews.Content: We booked and un-booked the last serenity room on the floor with the public deck. No serenity there. It is however perfect for a party. The deck outside your room is just feet away. NO view and No way worth the price. Very very busy place lots of bars and activity.

Reviews.Title: “Great service let down by poor building”
Reviews.Author: mjs_nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a trip around the west coast. Had goodservice from all the staff however would not stay at the hotel again. This hotel although reasonably new just seemed to have really badly designed rooms and had a cheap interior feel for the price. Walls didn't block out sound from the rooms next door (we could here people talking with pretty much no problems), bathroom door didn't shut properly = no privacy in the bathroom, sharp wood surrounds on the bed and the desk chair had legs that were easy to trip over. Part of the bathroom sink also broke so just added to the overall feeling of lack of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for a getaway with friends - loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: mightaswellbaby
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights in early May with a large group of friends - we occupied almost every room on the "Pool Deck." I can't recommend this hotel enough - great location, great staff, great rooms, great food and drinks, etc. The rooms are large, modern, clean, and extremely comfortable. Rooms on the 2nd floor have sliding glass doors that open directly to the Pool Deck - each room has a small sitting area outside with sheer curtains for privacy, if needed. We spent each day lounging in the chaises overlooking Pacific Beach (awesome people-watching!), went out at night, then returned to sit around the fire pit on the deck late at night. "Room" service was fantastic - we had drinks and food (and more drinks...) delivered up to the deck - and Zack went above and beyond to take care of us (thanks Zack!!). Food from JRDN was excellent and provided a unique alternative to standard hotel room service. Every aspect of my stay far exceeded my expectations, and I can't wait to go back - this is the perfect way to enjoy Pacific Beach!

Reviews.Title: “the best servise i have ever had in my life”
Reviews.Author: Remon408
Reviews.Content: It was my brithday weekend and my Fiance want to take me out we didnt know the area but (Sanan Hanna) works for tower 23 gave us the best advise of where to go and what to eat where to rent boats and every thing that you have to resarch he had it on his finger tips. He was eaven able to help my fiance to get me a surprise cake for my birthday i really thank him and the hotel management for a great staff keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: NycM26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week long trip to SD. We split our time between T23 and the Loews in Coronado. I was hesitant to stay at the hotel because there was no pool , however I liked that it was right on the beach. I think my husband was a little shocked when we pulled in since the hotel is literally in the back of a parking lot. After checking in we were told that there would be a party out in the deck area. What the front desk failed to mention was that the "small party" was basically an open party to all of pacific beach. So after a long flight from NY we couldn’t even relax on our balcony because there was essentially a wet t-shirt contest going on below us. Needless to say not the kind of thing you expect from a hotel that charges upwards of $250 a night. We kindly asked the front desk to move us just for the night to an ocean front room. This way we could at least relax without having to deal with the blaring music, since our room overlooked the deck area. They told us of course we would be able to do it for another $80 a night. That really set me off because they should put the comfort of their guest first., as the money wasnt the issue for us. When the party finally ended after 6, we went back up the deck area which was by now a mess and it seemed that all of the other hotel guest began emerging from their rooms also. Our next few days at T23 weren't as bad, they sent us up some free champange which was a nice effort. The food at JRDN is very good and, the view from the deck of the beach is A+. The server on the deck Drew was great and extremely attentive, he was as attentive as I thought the rest of the staff at T23 should have been. The hotel is close to La Jolla which is nice if you want a change of scenery. My last complaint about T23 is that on our last day there was a foul mouthed hotel employee who was getting wasted with one of her friends on the deck . Apparently it was her day off and she was using her discount ... I wasn’t listening to her conversation she was just that loud that I couldn’t help but overhear. Overall Tower 23 is a bad imitation of a trendy Miami hotel, ,they definatley need to train their staff on the art of hospitalty. They should limit hotel areas to the enjoyment of paying hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: pete_wendy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. It was clean, spacious, and the Tempurpedic beds were very comfortable to sleep on. The staff was friendly and we were greeted with two cocktails when we checked in. We had an ocean front room with a balcony which was definitely worth the extra cost. We never wanted to leave! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The ocean front rooms were a long walk from the lobby, but that didn't really bother us. The only thing that might be a drawback is that the balconies are very close together and there isn't much privacy. Luckily there was no one staying in the room next to us while we were there. A smoking neighbor could get very annoying if you are a non-smoker (the rooms are non-smoking but people were smoking on the balcony). Nice bathtub and sink from Kohler, although the sink was a tiny bit higher than we are used to. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: danieltjames
Reviews.Content: Tower 23 is a cool hotel in a nice location. There are plenty of bars and restaurants close by. The room we had had a balcony with sea view which was worth the extra cost. Plenty of goodies in the room and very comfortable bed. Welcoming staff and concierge. Nice restaurant attached to the hotel which had decent good value food. The bar within the hotel is a popular destination in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Simon14
Reviews.Content: The rooms I think were average, but very clean, and the beds were really comfortable - We had a surf pad looking directly over the ocean, beautiful. I recommend getting a room with the ocean view, it's worth it. We sat on the balcony and people watched and read, it was really nice. We were on the south most side of the hotel, the farthest from JRDN, which on some evenings can get pretty noisy. We only heard a little bit of music one night, not bad at all. We were there during the week however, I understand it can get pretty noisy on the weekend. The hotel is also very close to Seaworld and San Diego Zoo. The San Diego Wild animal park is about 30 miles away, but really worth going to. It was really enjoyable, splurge on a photo safari. One thing to remember is there is no pool at this hotel, this is usually a deal breaker for me, however, because of the location right on the beach, and there is a patio with some water features and heating lamps for chilly evenings we went ahead with staying here, and it was a really nice experience. A side note: Stay away from Anthony's Seafood Grotto on the harbor, it was horrible food.

Reviews.Title: “We WILL be back!”
Reviews.Author: DLB7031
Reviews.Content: We can't begin to describe our stay at Tower 23. From the moment that we walked in to the lobby to check in, to the moment that we checked out, we had a wonderful experience. We stayed in a "Surf Pad" room with a 2nd floor balcony that looked out over the ocean. It was a birthday celebration that the hotel recognized with a complimentary room service appetizer and dessert tray. A perfect location to be able to walk to good restaurants, and short drive to La Jolla restaurants, and Gaslamp restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MMChicagohearts
Reviews.Content: PROS: -Rooms were very clean -Staff was extremely friendly, quick, and accommodating -We got complimentary sweets upon telling staff that it was our honeymoon -Food from room service and restaurant was AMAZING, probably the best we ate in San Diego -We stayed in the Spirit Pad room and the Sanctuary Suite; both were spacious and fabulous. -Whirlpool in suite was clean and relaxing. -Location on the beach is beautiful and convenient; the Pacific Ocean is in the hotel's backyard! CONS: -Parking was $20 a night, and the only options were the paid hotel parking or street parking, which were mostly tow zones. WEIRD: -Bathroom doors didn't lock or close all the way by design; they were open an inch or two - meant for romantic couples only! -Waterfall feature in the Sanctuary Suite whirlpool; neat at first, but got annoying fast Overall, we had an excellent experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: neumanennt
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to SD, I planned to propose to my girlfriend. I reserved the Sweet Suite and Tower23 took care of me very well. They were happy to provide and plan for me, roses, petals, candles, choc covered strawberries, and they even set the jacuzzi tub up at just the right time for our surprise, it was amazing! Elizabeth was especially helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Even the locals go there to get away”
Reviews.Author: SMBMAK
Reviews.Content: During our stay at the Tower23 Hotel, we met several people from the San Diego area who were staying there as a local getaway. The hotel is quite unique in the area and was a great place for our family of four. We booked two connecting beachfront rooms and the view is incredible. Some of the beachfront ("surf pad") rooms overlook the courtyard (ours did) so be specific in your request. It was quiet on the deck while we were there but I'd imagine summer weekend evenings would be loud. We liked looking out over the deck with its seating area and fire. Many of the rooms open directly onto the patio - some like it that way, some don't. Again, ask in advance. The rooms are what you might expect at a trendy hotel. Well-appointed but somewhat minimalist. The beds were great and baths very nice. Not much space to store clothing and with just a couple wall sconces in the room, don't plan on reading in bed too easily. The staff was great and extremely responsive to any request. They knew the area well. While we were at the hotel, breakfast wasn't available (I'd suggest you skip the "breakfast" package - basically yogurt and granola). However, Kono's is next door and it's GREAT! We started every day there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you like quiet rooms at night”
Reviews.Author: lookinforsun50
Reviews.Content: The beautiful scene and lovely room balance my opinion of it to average as the noise was very frustrating. You can hear doors slam, and people talking from down the hall or below/above you. If there are late night patrons (there were every night), you can hear them until the wee hours.

Reviews.Title: “No support for our troops!”
Reviews.Author: cmiller68
Reviews.Content: As a 21 year military veteran of the armed forces, I emailed the hotel to inquire about discounts, specifically military discounts. I was told that, and I quote, " Unfortunately we are a boutique hotel and do not offer a military discount". I'm certain this hotel offers discounts to various companies and organizations. It's a shame they can't do the same for our US military veteran's,.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelivable,Hotel Like No Other!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RileyStafford
Reviews.Content: This Place was amazing. I had booked it through Booking.Com, and got a decent rate of around $199 a night. The Hotel was to be a surprise as part of our Honeymoon, and it did not disapoint us!!!! On arrival, we were checked into a wonderful room, and were lucky enough to catch the sunset, which was "awe inspiring". After this we had a meal in the restaurant downstairs, which was very expensive, but worth it just for the views, and cool atmosphere. As the other reviews state, there was a deck upstairs, and after dinner we sat upstairs, and spent the rest of the night there it was brillant!!!!! Yes it was expensive, but worth every penny!!! A great place for a romantic weekend, or a couple on a Honeymoon. We even had champagne served to our room, as they had heard it was Honeymoon, when they heard us talking upon check in!!!! Go here, it was awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Fabulous Tower23”
Reviews.Author: kjsand
Reviews.Content: A couple of weeks ago (Dec 5th, 08) my boyfriend surprised me for my birthday by booking a room for the weekend at the beautiful Tower23 in San Diego. As a native of the often busy and sometimes chaotic Los Angeles this couldn’t have been more perfect. Upon arrival we were immediately tended too by a wonderful staff that was quick to make sure we had everything we needed to make my weekend memorable. This was definitely accomplished by the added extras that were put together by the staff to adorn the room in celebration of my birthday. As we walked into the room I found a great tasting bottle of wine, balloons and about six different deserts. The room itself was simply lovely. We had the perfect view of the ocean which allowed us to enjoy the beautiful sunset along with the great sounds of the waves. The size of the room was perfect for my boyfriend and I and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud. We slept like babies. The hotel also has a great restaurant where we enjoyed a romantic dinner with a view of the ocean. Here again the waiter and accompanying staff were very attentive and pleasant. After dinner we had a couple of drinks at there outside deck which had a fire pit and nice lounge seating. Overall my birthday weekend was perfect. Great company, awesome food, a fabulous room with the perfect view, what more could a girl ask for. As we woke to the music of the waves, it was a bit sad to know that I would soon be leaving the tranquility of our hotel room and have to go back to the craziness of LA. I will definitely stay again. Thank you to the staff such as Elizabeth Hermosillo the hotel manager who gave my boyfriend great suggestions which helped him plan the entire trip. The girls at the reception desk were great and our waiter Tom was awesome. He too made great suggestions for our dinner that night. In my travels I have found that a hotel is only as good as its staff. At Tower23 my boyfriend and I had a fabulous weekend and I believe it was partly due to the excellent staff who were always very attentive and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Tower 23”
Reviews.Author: Anthony220383
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I decided to take 3 weeks out and venture on a mini road trip around the west coast of the states. We began in New York and flew over to L.A, from there we drove to San Diego where one of my friends had booked 2 rooms at Tower 23 hotel. From the moment we arrived we were all taken away by the epic view overlooking Pacific Beach. The sun loungers and water fountains added to this exotic feel, creating a sense of surrealism. The rooms were incredibly spacious and immaculately presented. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by a charming young lady on the reception desk who i remember by her name badge was called Rochel. She checked us in and even called us once we were in our rooms to make sure everything was ok. The restaurant and bar offered an array of well cooked food at a pleasant price, which suited us just fine. Overall the stay was by far the best we experienced in the USA, its just a shame that the most exhilarating aspect of our time in San Diego was our visit to sea world. Oh well there's always next time!!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing and wonderful time at the Tower 23!”
Reviews.Author: CloieForkers
Reviews.Content: A truely delightful trip! My boyfriend surprised me with a trip to San Diego. He choose this hotel because it was up scale, and on the beach with a spectacular view of the ocean and the Crystal Pier. The service was impecable both in the hotel and the restaurant. Although we were dissappointed that we could not have breakfast in the wonderful restaurant, JRDN, the food was delicious! The service in the hotel was enchanting, especially from Sabastian. His extradinary guest service and his polite approach made us feel very special and well taken care of! We needed suggestions on what to do and see while we were there. He was very helpful in pulling out his sheet with all the sightseeing in San Diego, and directions on how to get to them. We followed his suggestions to see Point Loma and the Cabrillo Monument, & the little city of Ocean Beach. We also visited Balboa Park and all the lovely museums. We finished our day with a lovely dinner in Old Town. Viva the margarita! We highly recommend this property and all of its special service.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: emilyinusa
Reviews.Content: We only spent 1 night at Tower 23, but we would have happily spent a week. it's right on a beautiful beach with a gorgeous terrace - with plenty of comfortable sofas, lounge chairs and a beautiful fire pit for the cool evenings. we sat out and watched the sunset on the Pacific - the staff were very attentive - even serving us dinner outside under the heat lamps. the room was very modern & trendy - lovely shower & very clean. i would recommend getting a room with a sliding door out to the terrace. the locale is great for walking, surfing, biking, swimming or just people watching. we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Beach in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: ShutterbugLA
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique hotel right on the beach and the perfect place for a get away weekend from Los Angeles. I stayed here over the Columbus Day weekend for a little R & R and a chance to unwind by the beach. I can't recommend this hotel enough! I give the staff high marks on customer service. Everyone was super friendly and helpful - valet, front desk, housekeeping, waiters. I agreed with the other reviewer, Sabastian was great to us. We looked pretty lost trying looking at our CA map for Balboa Park and he stepped right in, pulled out a cheat sheet for getting to local attractions from the hotel, highlighted the hotel numbers and asked us to call if we needed anything. We didn't even ask, he stepped right in just handled it (luvthat!). This hotel is in a great location for recreational activities. There's a very nice bike path all along the beach so bring a bike or rent one across the street for $20. They have a bike rack in the garage. In the evening throw on a sweater and go sit outside by the gas fire pit on the patio overlooking the ocean. You can't beat the sound of the ocean waves, salty air, starry sky, and a drink from the bar downtairs. The rooms are decorated in a clean modern design and i loved the crisp white linens they change every day. The room was also equipped with an xbox but I was too busy unwinding i never bothered to ask for some game time. I'll be back soon for another three day weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pacific Beach Location”
Reviews.Author: cmkw
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, boutique hotel. We stayed 2 nights in the Oceanside Surfpad room - we left the door open all the time to hear the surf crashing.... The room is very comfortable, modern and airy feeling. The bed was a SUPER comfortable Tempurpedic mattress. The only thing I find missing and desperately wanting was an in-room coffee pot so I could linger in bed and hang out on the deck in the morning. The restaurant Jordan was excellent although a little expensive. If you like living like a local - I would recommend having a beer at the 710 Beach Club around the corner and for another tip go to Cass St. Bar and Grill for beers and their grilled fresh fish plates....

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: dfaler
Reviews.Content: Tower23 is a very Clean and Modern Boutique Hotel in Pacific Beach. It definitely has the South Beach feel to it, in vibe and appearance. The rooms are very clean and simple with very comfortable beds. My wife and I did not want to get up in the morning. It has private balconies that have white curtains that blow in the ocean breeze. The overall experience was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: PickySanDiego
Reviews.Content: I was recently married at Tower 23. It was an unforgettable event. The service was impeccable. The food at JRDN was out of this world. The view from our room was breathtaking. We had many guests from out of town that stayed at the hotel as did we. At every single turn we were greeted by professional staff that went above and beyond all of my expectations to help us accomplish everything we needed. I live in San Diego and really could have had my wedding at any number of beautiful locations but I am so happy we decided to have it at Tower 23. I would highly recommend this hotel and their restaurant, JRDN, to anyone that wants a sophisticated, relaxing vacation, or just a dinner you will not soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “We want to come back”
Reviews.Author: ChinaXiaobao
Reviews.Content: My parents and I did an America tour in June andstayed in many Hotels through the country. Tower23 was our favoriteHotel (we stayed there for 2 nights). Everyone of the staff memberswere very friendly and helpful and were patient when I had to translatefor my Parents. The Hotel is very clean and design. The food in therestaurant was the best we tasted on our trip. I really want to go backsoon and sit on the "tower deck" and watch the surfers. Very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously Overpriced !!”
Reviews.Author: Faffey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tower23 for 2 nights in July. We booked it as a last minute relaxing location as we have been traveling north america and were in need of some R&R. We found the Tower23 on trip advisor and after all the glowing reviews went ahead and booked. At an average of $300 a night we were expecting ALOT more than what we got. Of course the 1* status we have listed it as is not accurate, I would state 3* to be closer but we felt it needed to be given such a low rating to make people aware!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! The rooms claim (and appear on the website) clean cut, modern and simple when in fact they could be more accurately described as white washed walls with self assembly furniture from Ikea. We could not believe that a hotel with this price tag did not even have shower units, just an over bath shower with a pull around curtain! The room was clean, however furniture looked old and delapidated, not fitting in with there "chic, modern" style it was trying to achieve. On first checking into our room we found that our "partial sea view" in fact meant looking onto the roadside. Unhappy with this we called down to switch rooms, they offered us another Sky suite (which is what we booked) or an upgrade to a Surf pad, for the EXTRA COST of $40 a night. We swtiched to the other sky suite not wanting to waste more money on our stay, which looked onto the patio deck, which looked onto the sea. (All of which is to be expected from a hotel, however when waiting at reception to ask a question we overhear someone checking in later than us, getting upgraded to the surf pad FREE OF CHARGE!) The staff were generally nice and pleasant. Nothing more nothing less. Because we have stayed in so many hotels for the past 2 months we really expected something special from the tower23, it simply did not deliver. You are paying for a moderate room, but a great location, and that's the only reason they get away with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation with style”
Reviews.Author: ThewanderersAuckland
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quite by accident. And we are please to report that it was a very happy experience. We had been travelling for about 2 months prior and were ready for a chill out and relax period by a beach in the sun and the location of Tower 23 fitted this requirement perfectly. We stayed for 5 nights in one of the rooms overlooking the sea. (and above the restaurant). The room itself was was very sylish and contemporary and we loved sitting on the balcony watching the world go by. We found it was a real bonus having such a great restaurant in the hotel and also had food delivered to our room. We had great service from pretty much everyone we encountered. There was some noise from the restaurant in our room but this stopped around midnightish and we didn't find it a real issue at all. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. C & A Loader, Auckland, New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: BeenAroundFolks
Reviews.Content: What an incredible place to spend a few days, or more! From the word go it was terrific. I liked the lack of pretentious superiority so many higher end hotel staff like to throw your way. None of that here. The staff just wanted to help and be accommodating. Our room was wonderful. Minimalist, think "W" hotel style. Its very best feature was the private balcony overlooking the ocean. We slept at night with the windows open listening to crashing waves all night. Heavenly! Don't know what kind of bed it was (should have checked) but it and linens just perfect. Seldom when travelling do I feel at home as much as I did in their bed. The scallops served in the hotel's signature restaurant JRDN are amongst the best I've ever had. The room service breakfast equally wonderful. I might suggest doing what it takes to get a room with the ocean view. The interior rooms without just didn't appear anywhere nearly as compelling. The location of the hotel is perfect too. Literally just a few steps to the beach. The hotel is right in the middle of the action too. Just behind it is a supermarket for mixes, wine, whatever. Lots of life but not rowdy, felt perfectly comfortable night and day. Higher end beach scene going on here. Surfers out day and night. Stroll on beach, on walkway above, or along shop sidewalks. Valet parking quick and courteous. Check in informed and efficient. We had a package affair with my name personalized onto each appropriate voucher. Nice touch. As it is a popular night spot as well if you want to take advantage of sleeping with balcony doors open I'd also recommend requesting a room on the beach south end of building as the noisier action below is at the north end of the hotel building. Although I've stayed at fancier hotels, I am hard pressed to think of an overall hotel experience that I've enjoyed more. No doubt it was expensive but I think it was good value for money. Often I think that I've overpaid and not received what I expected for my hotel dollar. Not here. Highly, highly recommended. You'd almost think I have some ulterior motive, and I don't. It is just nice to see a no-name independent hotel put such a good foot forward.

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary Suite was just that...”
Reviews.Author: suite_escapes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a romantic stay at Tower23. Our experience, starting with a quick check-in, was very positive. We stayed in a Sanctuary Suite...king size bed, that you sink into, huge bath tub, ocean view, plasma mounted on the wall, and even an X-Box. Needless to say, we had a great time! Make sure to try the sushi at the restaurant and/or breakfast in the patio. This is a great place to stay when you want to get away for some R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: dtracyaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nites...that's about all we could afford! We were shocked at the price they get. The rooms are nicely appointed, but certainly not for the price. The overall feel is pretty snotty, which does not go with a beach atmosphere! We have stayed in the past at Capri by the Sea, but it was sold out. We will definately stay at Capri in the future. For LESS money you get a 1 or 2 bedroom condo with a full kitchen! SAME VIEW! If you are concerned with price, this is not the place for you. Just go North a few blocks to the Capri, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Bastfx
Reviews.Content: Tower 23 is a beautiful boutique hotel on Pacific Beach in San Diego. The service is good, the breakfast delicious, and the staff very attentive, professionally courteous and available if needed. This was refreshing in many ways! The accommodations are first rate, modern, hip and very comfortable. The sweetest part of Tower 23 for us was the large deck overlooking the beach. Lots of heat sources for those cool March nights (propane fueled fire pit) and well served in the day time with comfortable lounges. The location of Tower 23 is wonderful if you simply want quality accommodations and beach front location. The night life can suit middle age people like us, but there are a lot more bars etc., for youth. (I would not go to this beach anywhere near spring break.) The area feels safe for walking about in the evening, whereas in the daytime, walking the beach and watching the surfers is simply wonderful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, superb customer service, and very accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: playfulpastimes4u
Reviews.Content: My family and I had an exceptional experience at Tower23 Hotel! They made our first visit to San Diego an unforgetable one! The first night that we checked in, the whole family was exhasted from an early morning flight and an afternoon spent at Sea World. Manuel, the VERY polite and accomodating gentleman that greeted us at the front desk, went WAY above and beyond the customer service that I would ever expect anywhere (and I'm VERY big on service!). It was late, and we really didn't want to go outside of our hotel room, but some how and some way, we still neded to feed our children...lol. So, since the dining room/kitchen was closed, Manuel offered to walk to any of the surrounding restaurants to get us food and then offerer d to deliver it to our room! In the mean time, the kids fell asleep (and wouldn't wake up to order), I still felt that Manuel's sweet and friendly gesture was over the top NICE and definitely set the positive vibe of our whole trip to San Diego and stay at Tower23 Hotel!!!! Thank you so much, Manuel, you are the best and you definitely should be rewarded! We will definitely return!!!! ~Jennifer Pawlak

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Very Modern, Great Service, And Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: Juan_Vera
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on our 5 yr anniversary(march2nd) in the sancturary suite... I give it a complete 5/5! I would recommend to anyone looking for a short/long gateway. very Clean, very modern, and cannot beat the view...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Relaxing Time”
Reviews.Author: daydreamer291
Reviews.Content: March 9th 2008 Reviewed: Nothern Califonia Girls My sister and I stayed there for two days and will definatly be back. The Ocean views were amazing. They have a patio that you can hang out on and have drinks and it is for guests only. If you want to mingle there is a restaurant and bar below. We mainly hung out on the patio and just watched the waves and people pass by. It was exactly what we needed. It is very close to restaurants and shops, within blocks. It was also just enough out of the way the you weren't in the heart of Pacific Beach and all the bars but could walk 4 blocks and be there. We did eat at the restaurant Jordans one day for lunch and the food and service were wonderful. They serve Sushi at night but we never got a chance to try it. Our Bellman Randy was very helpful and knowledgable about the area and even filled our ice bucket up for us. The best part of the entire stay were the beds, I have a thing for down comforters and pillows. I usually travel with my own pillow but didn't have to use it. I had a tough time getting out of bed. We will definatly be back, or at least I will anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect SD beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: YClef
Reviews.Content: Everything about Tower23 was better than expected. The modern lounge music playing when you enter the room sets the tone for the experience - modern and relaxing. The blend of luxury and location is ideal. Staying right on the PB boardwalk gives you the authentic SD beach experience, but with the comfort and amenities you'd expect in La Jolla. The view from the Surf Pad was stunning and worth the extra money. The service was great...very accommodating but unobtrusive. The tempurpedic beds and flat screen tv's make the rooms feel luxurious. Tower23 is now a must-stay destination for us on our SD trips. The name has become synonymous for us with paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Or experience at Tower23 Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jessigrfx
Reviews.Content: Our experience with Tower23 hotel was phenomenal, we plan to stay there each and every-time we visit San Diego. I would like to share the exceptional service we received from Tower23 (Erin Brady) in planning, accommodating our guests, and perfecting our destination wedding in San Diego. I contacted Tower23, namely Erin Brady about 6 months before our February 23rd wedding date. We are partial to the pacific beach area (We are St. Louis, MO residents, but I was born and raised in San Diego) and were in search of a hotel that could comfortable accommodate about 25 of our wedding guests that we were flying to San Diego. We explained to Erin that although we planned to host our wedding ceremony and reception on Crystal Pier, we were in need of a hotel for our guests, that would be affordable, beachfront, in walking distance from the pier (Tower23 is literally a few foot steps down the boardwalk from the pier). Erin offered us a room block for our guests that included a great nightly rate, and very flexible reservation/cancellation limits, and BEAUTIFUL rooms. Tower23 is literally beachfront property; the view from your room is the Pacific Ocean, the pier, and the boardwalk. San Diego is captured right from your window or deck. The architecture is a new, modern, and gorgeous building. The rooms are crisp, clean, spacious, and soothing. The beds and linens are so exceptional that many of our guests jumped online to try to purchase the same mattresses and linens for their homes. You can literally melt into the beds for hours. The decks have a clean uninterrupted view of the water, full of lounge chairs, a fire ring, and wading pool and waterfall next to you. It is so spa like and tranquil there, a true vacation. Sure there is La Jolla, and Coronado Island, but really I feel like Pacific Beach gives a much more authentic San Diego experience to travelers. The swimming (and surfing) portion of the beach is directly in front of Tower23, and the hotel in ½ block from Garnet Avenue, which is the best street to hit for restaurants, bars, retail shops, and an authentic beach community. The food at the JRDN (Tower23’s attached restaurant) is awesome, we had the sushi, calamari, steak and fries, and the goat cheese dip, our table was very pleased, we loved everything. Oh, and the drinks, the cocktails are so good, make sure to indulge at least one night on your stay! I want to also make note that the staff at Tower23 was amazing. Erin Brady helped us, kept us updated, reassured me as “the day” approached, and accommodated even our most last-minute guests every step of the way. She was available anytime we needed her. The staff at the front desk accommodated many very unusual last minute needs or ours, and were always very willing to help in any way that they could. Just days before our wedding day we ran into a problem with our hired caterer for our reception at Crystal pier, my mom scrambled last minute to find a back up venue and caterer in case issues worsened, and sure enough Erin was there, ready and willing to help if we needed her. She was the only piece of mind that we had at that point. We had all of our guests come up to us at one time or another to tell us how friendly and helpful the staff at Tower23 was. And again everyone ranted and raved about how clean, beautiful, and comfortable the rooms were. My new husband’s exact words are, “ we will never stay anywhere else.” Thank you Tower23, we cannot wait to come back and visit you.

Reviews.Title: “Picture perfect get-away”
Reviews.Author: SoCaliforniaTraveler
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, the experience was two thumbs up! The impeccable staff and service proved to be one of the best hotels to stay at on the Southern California coast. The food at JRDN's was exquisite. The view itself made for an unforgettable site. The hotel is definitely on our most recommended list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but slightly overrated!”
Reviews.Author: exfarmer
Reviews.Content: Our office Christmas party occupied five rooms for one night, including dinner at the JRDN restaurant on the first floor. The restaurant took very good care of our group and the food and drink was very good. We sat outside and, by adjusting our seats, there was just the right combination of radiant heat and fresh air to suit everyone. This hotel is probably the best hotel in Pacific Beach (certainly not in San Diego), but there were several small things that a hotel in this price range should do better. We had a "surf" room that meant the room overlooked the Pacific Ocean. Although the San Diego area isn't overly warm in mid-December, our room was too warm even with the heat control turned all the way down. The central system apparently didn't allow for cooling at this time of year. So our only choice for sleeping was to open the large sliding doors and curtains. This arrangement won't suit those who don't like the sounds of the surf, and the Saturday night boardwalk scene, to drift in. Since our doors were open, unfortunately, our peaceful Sunday morning sleep-in was marred by the sound of passing skateboards on the concrete sidewalk outside. Others in our group had "surf" rooms also, but with the added feature of overlooking the second floor outdoor social/firepit area. At least one of these rooms was too warm also but opening the large sliding door allowed in too much of the noise from the crowd outside until the bar/restaurant closed. Our room was clean and modern, if a little spare. The only chair was the straight-back chair for the desk. The shower drain was clogged so much that we had to stagger our showers to give the water time to drain. The lamp over the smallish wash basin hung down directly in front of the narrow mirror so that anyone over about five and half feet tall needed to look to one side or the other to use the mirror. The separate bathtub's water supply entered directly out of a chrome fixture (basically a plate with a hole in it) in the CEILING. (Alternate guess: someone had removed the shower head that might have been there originally). As you might imagine, water falling from the ceiling into an empty tub splashed out onto the floor until the tub acquired an inch or two of water. I've included a picture of the tub's water outlet in the ceiling with the water running. This is a personal preference, but in mid-December we found only an arrangement of red amaryllis in the lobby that might be called a Christmas decoration. Nothing more was in evidence. Overall the Tower23 Hotel is a very nice place. But for the price, the attention to detail was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to hide away for a week!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eyyelash
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that my hubby and I travel often. We get away about 5-6 times per year and all we look for is to truly get what we pay for. We want cleanliness and we aren't into the "tourist" stuff that others seek. We both have very demanding jobs and just like to get away to get away from the rat race and do "nothing" for the week. Our trip started in L.A. as we wanted to take in two hockey games there (tickets at home are just impossible to get). Our plan was to leave right after those two games and then get down to the San Diego area to watch the waves crash on the shore from our oceanview room and spend some quality time together. When we arrived at the Tower 23, the experience could have taken a horrible turn. The original check-in was done by a male (who shall remain nameless for now) who really obviously couldn't have cared less and who really shouldn't be part of the Tower 23 team!!! He lied to us and tried to give us a room just immediately over the bar/restaurant although we specifically asked what was below us. He advised "a room" and fluffed us off and sent us on our way asap! We were extremely early and there was really no reason why he couldn't just put us in a quiet room right off the bat. He told us he could only do it if we agreed to switch rooms during our stay and this was not something we were about to do for the price we were paying. After returning from a nice long walk (rooms are guaranteed by 4pm), we saw that the front desk person had changed and thankfully, we approached Nancy. She immediately took charge of the situation. Having told her that we were looking for quiet time and would be spending a lot of time "in" or on the balcony, she quickly changed us to an amazing room on the top floor...just what we had paid for! From that point on, the visit was flawless!!! The rooms are very clean, the amenities are lovely and there are housecoats and lovely linen and towels for guest use. Although we didn't eat in the restaurant downstairs, it looked to be quite well attended by all. There is an amazing rooftop lounging area off the 2nd floor which overlooks the ocean. We saw many people there who spent the entire day and early evening (when they light the firepit and heat lamps) just relaxing and taking in the view. Quite simply, we tried to do what the locals do and ate where locals eat and often picked up and brought the food back to the room so we could eat on the balcony, sip nice wine and listen to the wonderful ambient sounds on the room music player. During the day , we walked down the boardwalk and took in 2 hr strolls. We went out for a couple of "nice" meals but Toronto is such a cosmopolitan city that there was really little we could get there that we couldn't get at home. That wasn't the purpose of the trip. This spot is amazing. You can blend in or rent a car and go into the city. We did both and had an incredible time. Once again, cudos to Nancy at the front desk for being so professional from the time we arrived to the time when we checked out!!! We don't often go back to the same spots but this might just have to be an exception!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: tinabeeana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our Anniversary this year and our stay although short and rainy was wonderful. Tower 23 really helped make our anniversary special. There was even a bottle of sparkling white white and chocolate dipped strawberries sent to our room. We stayed in a Surf Pad room with a beautiful view. Room was quiet, clean, smelled great and the temperpedic bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was great. We had rain shower bathtub and the lighting was very good. We had no problems adjusting the thermostat, watching TV or getting the xBox (which includes the DVD remote) to work. A previous review stated that the TV doesn't show regular programs but we accessed basic cable stations easily as well as the PPV shows and movies. I can't complain about the service. The guy who checked us in wasn't exactly friendly but he was competent and our experience with the rest of the staff was fantastic. Including the staff of JRDN, we had two wonderful meals there. The valet was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Thorsten12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tower23 and had an absolute great experience! We had a Surf Pad room facing the ocean and enjoyed every single minute there! The rooms are really comfortable and the bed is just amazing! Excellent Value! The service was also very good!

Reviews.Title: “Life's a beach”
Reviews.Author: Slip_Advisor
Reviews.Content: A white, almost cubic, comtemporary building, Tower23 is slightly monolithic within its surroundings, which appeared to be more laid-back and relaxed (young surfer crowd). The reception staff were very helpful on arrival, and even provided an automatic upgrape to the 'Surf Pad', a twin room with views of the ocean. The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable, especially the bed, which was of orthopedic standards. We stayed on the 2nd floor, which meant our balcony led out onto the roof garden, where the fire pit is kept aflame all night. The bathroom is also contemporary, with a rainfall shower, but no bath. The bathroom door is a sliding door, but was not too much of a problem in regards to privacy. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone, especially young singles, or couples. The rooms are superb, the service is welcoming and the area is perfect for a San Diego holiday by the beach,

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and bad management”
Reviews.Author: TravelMeow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a quite romantic get-away. Next door was having a party from night to dawn, we called front desk to complain about the noise. Nothing was done!!! In the morning, when we checked out again , we again complained about the noise and lack of sleep and poor experience we had. Mangerial staff did not come out and apologize. They took the ridiculous parking fee off. Overpriced, poor management. Don't go.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Modern Hotel in Classic Beach Setting”
Reviews.Author: Challenger007
Reviews.Content: Unexpectedly pleased with my recent stay at T23. It is a refreshingly high value modern hotel experience with all the key amenities located in an older Pacific Beach/ Mission Beach setting. This part of town can be dicey, but was cleaned up and given a fresh lease on life for the 21st Century. I really enjoyed the food despite the noisy weeked bar scene. The kitchen delivered exceptional dishes Breakfast through Dinner. The only hiccup-reconstituted OJ!! All told a great spot, great food, great service and certainly well under value for the experience. Added bonus...Pet friendly for your well mannered animal companion. Love the blowy drapes surrounding the deck-and the groovy outdoor fireplace overlooking the beach and Crystal Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Tower 23 is the place to stay in PB!”
Reviews.Author: Compasso
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Tower 23 over the 4th of July and the stay was fantastic; the room, the location and staff exceeded our expectations. The rooms are modern and spacious (see photos) and the property is clearly the nicest and newest addition to Pacific Beach. We had dinner in Jordan (the hotel's only restaurant) and the food and service was enjoyable; glass partitions separating the diners from the boardwalk provided terrific, unobstructed views of the Pacific Ocean and the activity. The hotel's atmosphere is lively and relaxed, encrusted with a hip decor and eclectic clientèle. The hotel is not for those looking to save a few $$ as the rooms (+/-$400) and dining are costly, but the experience will yield a nice dividend on your investment. The noise from the boardwalk can be a little loud, but the hotel has installed large, double-paned, glass, sliding doors that filter out the noise. Overall, great place-I would highly recommend Tower 23.

Reviews.Title: “Upset about Tower 23”
Reviews.Author: blondegirl1122
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the beach, however my stay was just mediocre. The room was okay, but did have a nice view. My major problem came upon checkout. My bill had charges on it from the restaurant downstairs. I had never eaten at this restaurant, and the name signed on the check was not even close to mine. The people at the front desk acted like they were still going to charge me. I was very upset and will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip but Unassuming... if that seems weird”
Reviews.Author: CkWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Tower 23 was a very hip little hotel, but also felt very laid back. Not as though we couldn't walk in if we weren't feeling fancy. The location is right on the beach which is fantastic and there's a great, great breakfast place down the street (Kona's). We still remember that breakfast! There's a pier within a very short walk where you can watch the surfers and fishermen. It was perfect for soaking up the atmosphere of PB. The public deck facing the ocean is a great design feature in that it allows everyone to relax and just take in the ocean at sunset (not just those folks who paid big bucks for the ocean view rooms.) Only drawbacks might be that you do need a rental car if you want to go anywhere else in San Diego. At the time we booked the hotel's website wasn't working for reservations, and then when it was it suggested we could have gotten a better deal/room(?) going direct thru them. I wrote and complained but never got a reply. The bar and restaurant staff are very cool and friendly, although it's a little weird that there aren't any sports at all on the bar's TV's. It was a little surreal to be sitting at a bar on the beach and there was *figure skating* on tv.

Reviews.Title: “Tower23: Nice property Which Needs New Managerial Staff”
Reviews.Author: SYNAPSEBoston
Reviews.Content: This is an upscale boutique hotel in Pacific Beach which is not readily accesible unless you have a car. It is about $30 from the airport and about the same to downtown San Diego. I was attending a business meeting /convention and was happy to be staying at this smaller property a bit away from it all with good reviews. I had a rental car which costs $20 per nite to park at the property. The rates per nite are pricey so I was expecting an experience consistent with such a rate. I arrived at about 2:30 PM after two long flights ; i travel a great deal and this was the end of a busy travel season . It was a Saturday afternoon and the front desk person indicated that the room was not ready and that they guarantee the room for 4 PM. This is approaching the late side for check in as most hotels are for 3 PM check-in. She asked for my cell phone and said she would call me when the room was ready. She did not do this and I returned after 3:15 PM and asked about my room and another gentleman indicated that my room was ready. While waiting, I saw that there was a wedding party readying for a ceremony /reception apparently at a different venue; but people were milling about by the small courtyard looking out over the beach. When I returned from a dinner meeting at 11 PM , the wedding revelers were now congregated outside my bedroom on the courtyard having drinks and making huge noise which continued until nearly 2 AM despite several calls to the front desk. This is a charming , small property and simply is not designed for such a real time celebration at the expense of guests' sleep. The nite manager was thoroughly inept and the daytime manager with whom I reviewed the matter was very gracious and abated one nite's charge by 50%. But the experience fouled my sense of the place. The bar is hopping and I enjoyed being out for drinks with colleagues on one nite. The restaurant is simply outstanding with beautifully prepared food and staff who are professional across all domains. Rivalled any restaurant experience in great dining places around the country. But the management has to decide whether this is an upscale boutique hotel or whether it is a function hall . The manager made a decision to sell drinks through the nite on the private courtyard the remnants of which I captured on my cell phone camera in the early AM and to ruin the experience of others versus asking the party to move to the very large bar at the other end of the hotel.It was a bad decision on the manager's part and which he never addressed. While the other staff were truly gracious and helpful during my stay, this hotel needs a "top-down" managerial review .

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: jamiedanielle
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in quite sometime, everything was outstanding from the rooms, service and food! We had such a great time and would highly recommend Tower23 to friends, family and anyone looking for a truly exceptional hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CT-TravelerEssex
Reviews.Content: The Tower 23 Hotel in San Diego (Pacific Beach) was perfect. It's very modern/sleek. Everyone in the hotel was very helpful and very friendly. The rooms were great, the "Tower Deck" was the greatest - a quiet place to watch the surfers, sunsets and everyone on the beach. They even serve drinks and food on the deck. Had planned to do some sightseeing, but ended up on the Tower deck every afternoon. It's a great location, lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Very relaxing..... I'd go back in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A diamond on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Sgoudeseun
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 3-day business meeting at the hotel. The service was excellent, the rooms were spacious, and the food was great. The decor of the hotel and rooms are ultra modern and very comfortable. Flat screen digital televisions in the room and free wireless internet make the stay very enjoyable. The restaurant is open and spacious, with excellent food that makes it un-necessary to leave the premises. The PB boardwalk is just out the door for a fresh air walk along the ocean. Although this trip was for business, I would not hesitate to take my wife or family back for some R&R or fun in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at T23”
Reviews.Author: retaks
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend getaway at Tower23 and had an awesome time. The location is perfect - good people watching, can hear the waves, lots of things within walking distance. If you stay here, I'd recommend surf pads only. The rooms are small and the decor OK, but the views are beautiful. It's well worth the upgrade! We ate at Jrdn both days and were not disappointed. At night, the bar is very fun and hip. And the food is yummy, although on the pricier side. The only negative is the inconsistent staff. However, we enjoyed the laid back attitude - mostly college and surf kids. I can see how that can annoy some people. The staff responded to all our requests and after several attempts, were able to accommodate us every time. Overall, we had a great time. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Never Quite There......”
Reviews.Author: vocular
Reviews.Content: Tower 23 really wants to be a world class luxury hotel. It doesn't have a chance. The property is situated in a fine setting: directly along the ocean in Pacific Beach. Its convenient to a lot of tourist spots and the neighborhood surrounding the hotel has some interesting shops and restaurants, all within walking distance. But the hotel itself is a disappointment. The decor, for example, is late American modernism, but the furniture looks and feels like it was purchased at Ikea and assembled by the staff. The hotel advertises free wi-fi, but the wi-fi wasn't working too well when I was there this week. They offered to provide me with a "better" speed internet access via a cable connector. But that would cost $12.95 extra a day. Then there's the 42 inch flat screen television. Its a great television. But the batteries in the handset needed replacement and they never got around to it, so I gave up pressing buttons that didn't respond. When I did get the television to work I discovered that it doesn't show regular programs. It offers "selected television episodes" of a few shows. But you have to pay for the priviledge. And so the tone is set for the hotel. There are numerous "extras" that all nickel and dime you to death. The hotel incorporates a bar/restaurant that is quite nice, but music from the bar drifts up to rooms on the second floor. I walked to the third floor and the music wasn't audible there, so if you go request a room on the third floor. The music also intrudes upon the second floor beach deck. Its a great deck, but the sound of the ocean is almost drowned out (no pun intended) by the hip muzak playing from speakers on the deck. The rooms were attractive and clean. But acoustics were poor. We could hear people talking in the room next door, and footsteps in the room above were thudding along almost all the time. I've stayed places where this was the norm and its fine as long as you know about it and are prepared for it. The balconies are very nice and I spent a fair amoun of time sitting out there watching the ocean. The idea of valet parking is nice but the staff is sllooooooow and request your car at least fifteen minutes in advance. Also, the garage closes around midnight and while they can get your car or park it after that hour its a time consuming and complicated process. For the price ($259 for the surf pad full view room) its not a bad deal. But this hotel desperately wants to be a new york city, soho, high tech hotel on the beach. Its not even close.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Beach Gem”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I just returned from our annual Mother/Daughters trip. This year we chose San Diego. We stayed a bit North in Pacific Beach. We stayed at Tower 23. The hotel is right on the beach. Our room was on the second floor and in a corner, so we had a sliding door all glass wall looking at the ocean. A spectacular view! Also a smaller side window. The beds were wonderful. The room was very roomy. Our room was just above the bar area. The noise on Saturday was pretty awful. On Friday not so bad. On Monday it was great. I would stay here again. Good granola/yogurt breakfast! Very hip place. You have to pay $12 daily for parking. The valets were great! Overall a nice experience in a great location. Lorraine

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Suprised”
Reviews.Author: dwardlow
Reviews.Content: Having moved from a downtown harbor hotel - Mission/Pacific Beach looked a little run down --- HOWEVER, Tower 23 is tucked away at the beach and is a trendy little hotel. If you've stayed at a W Hotel then this would look familiar. Bed was GREAT. Restaurant was GREAT (dinner and breakfast). We had the partial ocean view on the second floor. It has a great patio area that look toward the ocean. Highly recommend this little hotel. Parking was only $15 a night which is considerably less than downtown. For those seeking the GasLamp dining --- it's only a 20 minute drive at most.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Surferleo
Reviews.Content: A friend told me about this hotel and I was pleasantly surprised to discover how much I enjoyed it. I am a native San Diegan who has lived in the Bay Area for several years. I am always on the hunt for a new place to stay when I "come home." Tower 23 is my new favorite hotel. The rooms are large and very comfortable. This is NOT a family hotel, but very nice for singles and couples. The staff was very helpful and friendly. When I had a very rowdy crowd keeping me awake next door, the hotel clerk and the security guard came to the offender's door and took care of the problem right away. The restaurant is excellent, particularly for breakfast and lunch. My only complaint is that they should ban cell phones in the restaurant. I do not need to hear people's personal business while I sit with my morning paper and cup of tea. The location is great, too. Also, the weather is perfect in August. Do not come to San Diego in June - June gloom, take it from a native.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: gnawh2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Tower23 over president's weekend in February. Very smart + unique approach to a modern boutique hotel. Located right on pacific beach where you can people watch on the 2nd floor balcony, watch the sunset in the evening next to the firepit. Great hotel for young couples and singles. Tempur-pedic mattres and H2O products in the bathroom is a plus. Eats: George's in La Jolla, Extraordinary desserts, and local eateries near Corona del mar. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around...and loved it”
Reviews.Author: Seguso
Reviews.Content: I've stayed with my family at the Tower two times. Once was the first week that they were open. It was horrible...I could write a huge review on all of the many, many problems. My husband wrote the owner and to our surprise, he personally replied and invited us back for free. Wow, that never happens. We couldn't do another trip until about 9 months later, and actually, we weren't sure we wanted to go back, even for free. But we did and man, have they improved. Both visits we stayed at the sweet suite...and it is. The best beach view, wonderful bed and the coolest bathtub. Everything was really clean, and that's important, I hate dirty hotels, especially the bathroom. The Jordan restaurant is directly under the balcony, makes for good people watching but does get a bid loud at night. We were traveling with two very young kids so we were in our rooms by around 8:00 every night, so the noise was a little annoying, but really not that bad. Jordan really fills up at night, looked like fun. The food there is great, try the filet, yum. Being so close to the beach was great, I highly recommend the Tower. If staying there try the sweet suite. If not that room be sure to get one with a beach view, they are limited. Some of the views/patios are in a common area, I personally wouldn't like that, people can stare right into your room. Overall, love the place. Will for sure stay again.

Reviews.Title: “TERROR 23! stay here at your peril!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, can we say "attitude adjustment"! My girlfriend and I stayed here for a night and were happy to escape with just an assault on our character. It all started well, nice room, good view, hip bar....until we arrived back from dinner in downtown san diego...en route to the bar for a night cap we were confronted by a belligerent staff member asking "can i help you?", I told him we were hotel guests and he told me to "go f**k yourself"! I couldn't believe it! I asked to see the manager and there was no manager available. I made a complaint to the front desk, where they told me they had had problems with that staff member previously. I emailed the hotel manager when I returned home. No response from Terror 23, still awaiting an acknowledgement or apology. The whole thing ruined our stay in San Diego and we wouldn't want anyone else to have this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Surf Pad”
Reviews.Author: EatSantaBarbarian
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at Tower 23. The view from our Surf Pad room was gorgeous. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and I loved the modern look. However, it was sometimes a case of form over function. The bath shower was somewhat broken when we arrived and the handle on the shower came off. The toilet paper holder was angling toward the ground so the roll wanted to slide off. Nothing was wrong that an allen wrench couldn't fix and when I reported the issues they fixed them promptly. Well, all but the toilet paper roll holder as I didn't report that. I really wanted the shower working properly and didn't want to confuse the issue. The lighting looked nice but it really wasn't bright enough to do makeup. I think all the minimal hard surfaces also allowed sound to travel as we could hear the neighboring rooms more than I would have expected. The Tower bar was ultra cool and there was a long line to get into the restaurant bar downstairs on the weekend nights. We only had breakfast in the restaurant and it was another ultra cool spot. I had to laugh when the waters came with mangled chucks of lemon hanging to the side. All that look and they cannot slice a lemon. I suppose it is more likely that mangled lemon is the new new thing and I am just behind. The staff was amusing. It was like watching kids play dress up. It seemed the valet staff knew more than anyone about how to handle guests. The others seemed too young for their jobs. But, I may jut have been too old for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights in one of the 'sky pads'. At first we were a little unsure of what it would be like when we were driving to it, as we had been in the city and been recommended this hotel by the visitor centre. It isnt too far from the main city maybe about 10 or 15 minutes drive. We knew it was just a new hotel, and it certainly lived up to the expectations of being very modern. The view was lovely from the room of the pier at the front and the sunsets were amazing. The bed was the most comfortable i have ever slept in, we had been travelling around california ,so it was just so relaxing to get great nights sleep! It was sooo good to get up in the morning and stroll along the beach front and watch the surfers! The staff were also very friendly and helpful. I would definately reccomend this hotel(i think it is even in the Conde Nast book of good hotels!) We stayed during the week which was fine for noise, but i think it gets a bit noisy at the weekends,if you want a relaxing stay here, then go during the week!

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Beach contemporary cool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tower 23 because we loved the contemporary design we saw on the hotel's website. The furnishings and the rooms are very thoughtfully designed. There's a low-height table that's perfect for placing your bags if you don't want to unpack, and the Do Not Disturb sign is an electronic button on the wall rather than a flimsy piece of cardboard. The staff respected the do not disturb and let us sleep until 4pm after we had a very late night. We had a sanctuary suite which was absolutely incredible - I want this bathroom for my own house. The water falls in a perfect, quiet stream from the ceiling into a truly massive bathtub jacuzzi with colored underwater lights and three different kinds of bubble jets. My husband and I both got into it easily; I think it would be easy to fit four normal-sized people, or to swim in it if you're alone. The bathroom is separated from the rest of the one-room suite by only a curtain, which gives a nice open feel to the whole space. Later in our visit we also stayed in a surf pad room, with a full ocean view. We slept with the sliding door open to hear the waves. We also loved the neighborhood; you can walk along Pacific Beach and have breakfast by the ocean, or you can walk to funky secondhand shopping along Garnet Street which is a little like L.A.'s Melrose. There are many businesses within a third of a mile of the hotel - drugstores, supermarkets, Uno's pizza, Denny's, places that rent rollerblades and surf equipment, ice cream from ColdStone and Dairy Queen, et cetera. If you like to be in the heart of the action, this is the place. Because the hotel is small, there's plenty of staff attention paid to each guest. The front desk printed out boarding passes for me with no hesitation (their business center isn't open yet.) Every time we called for our car, it was ready for us by the time we got down the elevator. Yes, this is a pricey hotel, but I was happy with every aspect of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated & Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed there for 5-day vacation from the East coast and thought it was okay. I knew the reviews were mixed, but decided to stay there anyway to check it out for myself. The hotel is definitely overrated and it seems as though it didn't fit into the PB scence. Our first night there, it was obnoxious, b/c we could hear people downstairs at the bar screaming and fighting until 3AM! The other nights it was ok, noise level was moderate. Rooms are nice, no coffeemakers, but coffee was available downstairs, in a very awkward place (near the elevators), and was only available until 9am or so. The bathroom lights were dim, so you need to apply makeup in your room. Service was okay, I see where others complained about young staff and courtesy. The hotel was nice enough to print out our boarding passes before we left, but the girl at the front desk was so clueless. I had to tell her about 5 times our comfirmation # because she couldn't type? All in all, we though it was expensive for PB and probably would opt to stay in La Jolla next time.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as it looks”
Reviews.Author: dustrust
Reviews.Content: the service isnt all that good. there was a sanitation problem with our room that was never resolved, when i told the front desk the man just starred at me. no apology what so ever. he didnt even ask details of the problem. the employees seem young and inexperienced. the lights in the bathroom are very dim. so ladies bring a flashlight to apply your makeup.

Reviews.Title: “A Great New Beach Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: fboosman
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was taking a big chance with the TOWER23 hotel -- it was so new that it had only one review that I could find (here on TripAdvisor). I needn't have worried -- it was up there with the best hotels at which I've ever stayed, and most certainly was the coolest of them all. The TOWER23 hotel is an anomaly, an ultramodern hotel set in a bit of a funky beach town (the Pacific Beach area of San Diego). There's nothing nearby that's like it -- accomodations in the area range from mid-range condominiums to dilapidated cottages set on a pier. But the setting doesn't detract from the TOWER23, and in fact seems to bring it into sharper relief. I had an oceanfront room, a "Surf Pad," which was delightful. The bathroom was stylish, the shower large and equipped with a rain-style head. The bed was one of the two or three most comfortable I've ever slept on. The flat panel TV was great, and I used the Xbox to play DVDs that I had brought with me (you can borrow movies from the front desk, or there's a Blockbuster next door). The room had both wired and wireless connections to the hotel's free Internet service. But the star of the room was the view -- a third-story, top-floor view of the boardwalk, the beach, and the ocean. Sunsets were absolutely spectacular. The TOWER23 has its own ocean-view restaurant, JRDN. I had excellent sushi rolls there on two occasions, and my companion and I both thought that the breakfast we had was one of the best we could remember, and reasonably priced. At night, JRDN becomes a very hip club, and we took advantage of this almost every evening during our stay. Bring stylish clothes! The hotel has a second-floor deck with comfortable seating and a fire pit, the modern style with flames dancing over sand. We spent some very pleasant evenings there drinking cocktails brought up from the club below. I wouldn't recommend the TOWER23 for people who want a very quiet hotel. Although the rooms are soundproofed quite well, once JRDN becomes a club at night, it becomes fairly loud, especially on Friday and Saturday nights. This wasn't an issue for us, as we were making use of it, but I can see some people having problems with it. Nor would I recommend the hotel for people with small children -- the beach is really the only place for them to run around, as there's no pool or playspace of any kind -- it's just not that kind of hotel. To travelers looking for a beachfront hotel, a trendy place to stay, or a hotel where one can party into the wee hours, I can't recommend the TOWER23 highly enough. It's less expensive than many of the dull mega-hotels in the city, but with better rooms and polite, boutique-style service. I hope to stay there again someday!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hip little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Tower 23 to celebrate our 1st anniversary. The hotel was clean, modern and the staff, very professional. We enjoyed cold beers on the outdoor Tower Bar where the waitress was friendly and courteous. As we were checking in to our room the hotel staff asked "what brought you to Tower 23?"...we told her we were celebrating our 1st anniversary...and after returning to our room after having drinks...we found a tasty chocolate fudge dessert with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate. A very nice touch. Their restaurant...Jordan's was packed...we didn't try it...but the ambience and menu looked very appealing. We'll be back to try it. And...Kono's...a little breakfast place right next door is terrific...as is the little coffee hut. A great stay!

HotelInfo.Name: Tower23 Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 4551 Ocean Boulevard, Between Felspar St. & Garnet Ave., San Diego, CA 92109
